results.title: Funny face
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Roger Edens and Stanley Donen
results.brief_description: Fred Astaire stars as a fashion photographer looking for a new face to promote Kay Thompson’s fashion magazine. He discovers Audrey Hepburn working in a bookstore and transforms her into a model on the cover of the “Vogue-like” magazine. Shot on location in Paris and featuring songs by George and Ira Gershwin, “Funny face” is a song and dance delight, with romantic backdrops. Hepburn in her Givency clothes is stunning.

results.title: Funny bones
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Pictures, Peter Chelsom and Simon Fields
results.brief_description: Tommy Fawkes (Oliver Platt), is a struggling stand-up comedian trying to live up to the legacy that his famous father George Fawkes (Jerry Lewis) has created. George is now retired, and Tommy is struggling to get his career started. After yet another painful failure onstage, Tommy decides to travel back to Blackpool, England, where his family’s history and comedy originated and during his stay, Tommy discovers some not so funny secrets about his family and his past. During this time he develops a peculiar friendship with the mysterious Jack Parker (Lee Evans), the seemingly dim, comedian-savant. This film, a “black slapstick comedy” goes beyond any genre, utilizing brilliant psychological and physical performances right down to the eyebrow raising cameo from Oliver Reed. Written by Peter Chelsom and Peter Flannery.

results.title: Funeral in Berlin
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Charles Kasher, Guy Hamilton and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: In this 60’s espionage classic (a follow up to “The Ipcress File”), Michael Caine reprises his role as British secret agent, Harry Palmer, who reluctantly takes on a job in Berlin where his task is to organise the defection of a wily Russian military commander from East Berlin. Using his local underworld contacts, he arranges for the border crossing to take place in a coffin, as part of a mock funeral. Pursued by a glamorous Israeli agent and hindered by double dealing within his own organisation, Harry Palmer brings his own Cockney cunning to the fore to survive when his plans are thwarted and the wrong body arrives in the coffin. Based on a novel by Len Deighton.

results.title: Fun in Acapulco
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Hal B Wallis and Richard Thorpe
results.brief_description: While in Acapulco, Elvis is pretty busy employed as a boat hand, lifeguard, and singer. He’s managed to capture the attention of a few of the local beauties (Ursula Andress, Elsa Cardenas), which fills in most of the spare time he has. He harbours a secret fear of heights however, after a fatal mishap during his career as a trapeze catcher leaves him shaken. Love manage to inspires him to overcome his fear of heights in the most public way possible - diving off a 136 foot cliff. Features the following songs: “Bossa Nova baby”, “You can’t say no in Acapulco”.

results.title: Full metal jacket
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Stanley Kubrick
results.brief_description: Stanley Kubrick’s disturbing and darkly funny Vietnam war drama about the dehumanizing process involved in turning young men into trained killers is divided into two distinct acts. Based on Gustav Hasford’s “The Short-Timers”, the first part focuses on the slow descent into madness of a young recruit in basic training, Private Gomer Pyle (Vincent D’Onofrio). He undergoes a process of systematic torture, verbal abuse and cruel disciplinary measures administered by a sadistic drill Sergeant (Lee Emery). The second part shows the bastardization process in action as it follows Private Joker (Mathew Modine) as he navigates himself around the madness and senselessness of the Vietnam war. This isn’t the first time Kubrick has dealt with the inhumanities of war, having tackled similar themes in the brilliant ‘Paths of Glory’. With ‘Full Metal Jacket’ however, he achieves in presenting an absurd and chilling vision of hell on earth. Cast also includes Adam Baldwin, Arliss Howard, Dorian Harewood and Kevyn Major Hasford. Original music by Abigail Mead (Kubrick’s daughter Vivian Kubrick).

results.title: From Mao to Mozart: Isaac Stern in China
results.creator_credit: Harmony Film Group and Murray Lerner
results.brief_description: Isaac Stern and his family visited China for three weeks in 1989 as the guests of the Foreign Minister. Stern visits schools and conservatories of music, giving master classes and concerts, and speaking to music teachers who lived through the Cultural revolution.

results.title: From here to eternity
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Buddy Adler and Fred Zimmerman
results.brief_description: A searing indictment of military life, where one walks the line or pays the price. In a peacetime army camp in Hawaii, the commander’s wife, Deborah Kerr, and career soldier, Burt Lancaster, risk everything in a love affair that could destroy them. Persecuted by his peers, hard-headed Prewitt (Montgomery Clift) wants to settle down with prostitute Donna Reed, but she yearns for a better life. Prewitt’s only friend, Frank Sinatra, stands up to sadistic guard, Ernest Borgnine, and pays the ultimate price. The film culminates in an explosive climax on December 7, 1941, with the attack on Pearl Harbour. “From Here to Eternity” is a riveting drama, considered one of Hollywood’s greatest achievements. Based on the novel by James Jones.

results.title: From dusk till dawn
results.creator_credit: A Band Apart, Gianni Nunnari, Meir Teper and Robert Rodriguez
results.brief_description: After pulling off a bloody Texas bank heist, notorious bank robber Seth Gecko and his homicidal, rape-happy brother Ritchie, secure a safe passage across the border into Mexico thanks to the unwilling aid of disillusioned ex-minister Jacob Fuller. After kidnapping the Fuller family, the Gecko brothers elude the authorities and reach a supposed safe haven at a pre-chosen site: a surreal and ultra-sleazy bar in the middle of the desert, where they plan to split the loot with their Mexican connection. Unfortunately, the club is actually a haven for ferocious Aztec vampires; a twist which spins the schizophrenic plot into its second phase. Cast includes George Clooney, Quentin Tarantino, Harvey Keitel and Juliette Lewis.

results.title: Fried green tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Cafe (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions, ACT III Communications, Electric Shadow Productions, Fried Green Tomatoes Productions, Jon Avnet and Jordan Kerner
results.brief_description: Dowdy housewife Evelyn Cooch meets an elderly lady, Ninny Threadgoode, who transports Evelyn back to the 1930’s by weaving a magical tale about two women, gentle Ruth, and headstrong Idgie, who ran the Whistle Stop Cafe during the Depression. Idgie’s and Ruth’s friendship defied all odds, and remained strong even when the scandal of murder threatened to separate them. Academy Award winners Jessica Tandy and Kathy Bates play Ninny and Evelyn, while Mary-Louise Parker and Mary Stuart Masterton give excellent performances as the friends Ruth and Idgie. Based upon the novel by Fannie Flagg who also wrote the screenplay.
